gnat.representation
Class TextPositionModel

java.lang.Object
  gnat.representation.TextPositionModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class TextPositionModel
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Stores frequencies of tokens at different positions. A position can be defined arbitrary, e.g. 0 denotes left, 1 denotes middle, and 2 denotes right Comment: does a Laplace correction (adding one) for unseen events/strings

Author:
Conrad
See Also:

serialVersionUID

private static final long serialVersionUID
A position model for text. Stores which tokens occur at which positions and their frequency at this position.

                          int position)
Returns true if this token was never observed before at the specified position.

getFrequency

public int getFrequency(java.lang.String string,
                        int position)
Returns how often this string occurs at the given position. The minimum frequence is 1, so that unseen events have probability > 0 (Laplace correction)

getRelativeFrequency

public double getRelativeFrequency(java.lang.String string,
                                   int position)
Returns the frequency for a string at a position normalized by the frequency for all tokens at this position.

getRelativeFrequency

public double getRelativeFrequency(java.lang.String string,
                                   int position,
                                   int totalFrequencyAtPosition)
Returns the frequency for a string at a position normalized by the frequency for all tokens at this position.

getSequenceProbability

public double getSequenceProbability(java.lang.String[] strings)
Returns the probability of this sequence represented by this model. Note that the array length L should match the number of positions N in this model. If L is greater than N, only the first N elements are processed. If L is less than N, the complete array is processed without looking at the last N-L positions in this model.

getJointProbability

public double getJointProbability(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> strings,

Returns the joint probability that these strings occur at position i.

                                     int position)
Returns the max. probability of one the strings occuring at position i.
